FRBR.name: Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records
FRBR.description: Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records namespace

FRAD model.title: FRAD model
FRAD model.description: This is the element set of native RDF classes and properties described in the Functional Requirements for Authority Data model. The model also uses elements previously described in the Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records (FRBR) entity-relationship model.
FRAD model.name: FRAD model

FRBRer model.title: FRBRer model
FRBRer model.description: This is the element set of native RDF classes and properties described in the current text (Feb 2009) of the Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records (FRBR) entity-relationship model.
FRBRer model.name: FRBRer model

FRBRoo model.title: FRBRoo model
FRBRoo model.description: Element set of the Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records object-oriented extension to the the CIDOC Conceptual Reference Model (CRM)
FRBRoo model.name: FRBRoo model

FRSAD model.title: FRSAD model
FRSAD model.description: This is the element set of native RDF classes and properties described in the Functional Requirements for Subject Authority Data model. The model also uses elements previously described in the Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records (FRBR) entity-relationship model.
FRSAD model.name: FRSAD model

FRBRer User Tasks.title: FRBRer User Tasks
FRBRer User Tasks.description: Based on the current text, Feb 2009.
FRBRer User Tasks.name: FRBRer User Tasks

FRBRer User Tasks.title: FRBRer User Tasks
FRBRer User Tasks.description: Based on the current text, Feb 2009.
FRBRer User Tasks.name: FRBRer User Tasks

ISBD Elements.title: ISBD elements
ISBD Elements.description: This is a registration of classes and properties from International Standard Bibliographic Description (ISBD), consolidated edition, published by De Gruyter Saur in July 2011 (ISBN 978-3-11-026379-4).
ISBD Elements.name: ISBD Elements

ISBD Content Form.title: ISBD Content Form
ISBD Content Form.description: Content form categories reflect the fundamental form or forms in which the content of a resource is expressed.
ISBD Content Form.name: ISBD Content Form

ISBD Content Form Qualified Base.title: ISBD Content Form Qualified Base
ISBD Content Form Qualified Base.description: Compound terms for qualified ISBD content forms that map to RDA/ONIX Framework for Resource Categorization base content categories.
ISBD Content Form Qualified Base.name: ISBD Content Form Qualified Base

ISBD Content Qualification of Dimensiona.title: ISBD Content Qualification of Dimensionality
ISBD Content Qualification of Dimensiona.description: Content qualification sub-categories for the number of spatial dimensions in which the image content of a resource is intended to be perceived which expand the content form category of image.
ISBD Content Qualification of Dimensiona.name: ISBD Content Qualification of Dimensionality

ISBD Content Qualification of Motion.title: ISBD Content Qualification of Motion
ISBD Content Qualification of Motion.description: Content qualification sub-categories for the perceived presence or absence of movement in the image content of a resource which expand the content form category of image.
ISBD Content Qualification of Motion.name: ISBD Content Qualification of Motion

ISBD Content Qualification of Sensory Sp.title: ISBD Content Qualification of Sensory Specification
ISBD Content Qualification of Sensory Sp.description: Content qualification sub-categories for sensory specification, a human sense through which the content of a resource as published is intended to be perceived, which expand content form categories.
ISBD Content Qualification of Sensory Sp.name: ISBD Content Qualification of Sensory Specification

ISBD Content Qualification of Type.title: ISBD Content Qualification of Type
ISBD Content Qualification of Type.description: Content qualification sub-categories for type which expand content form categories.
ISBD Content Qualification of Type.name: ISBD Content Qualification of Type

ISBD Media Type.title: ISBD Media Type
ISBD Media Type.description: Media type categories record the type or types of carrier used to convey the content of the resource. Categories generally reflect the format of the storage medium and housing of a carrier in combination with the type of intermediation device required to render, view, run, etc., the content of a resource.
ISBD Media Type.name: ISBD Media Type

LRMer model.title: LRMer (IFLA Library Reference Model Entity Relationship)
LRMer model.description:
IFLA LRM is a high-level conceptual reference model developed within an entity-relationship modelling framework. It is the consolidation of the separately developed IFLA conceptual models: FRBR, FRAD, FRSAD.

IFLA LRM was developed to resolve inconsistencies between the three separate models. Every user task, entity, attribute and relationship from the original three models was examined, definitions had to be revised, but also some remodeling was required in order to develop a meaningful consolidation. The result is a single, streamlined, and logically consistent model that covers all aspects of bibliographic data and that at the same time brings the modelling up-to-date with current conceptual modelling practices.

IFLA LRM was designed to be used in linked data environments and to support and promote the use of bibliographic data in linked data environments.
LRMer model.name: LRMer model

MulDiCat.name: Multilingual dictionary of cataloguing terms and concepts
MulDiCat.description: Multilingual dictionary of cataloguing terms and concepts namespace

MulDiCat.title: Multilingual dictionary of cataloguing terms and concepts (MulDiCat)
MulDiCat.description: Terms for cataloguing and classification concepts, reflecting international agreements, intended to be used for authoritative translations of cataloguing standards and related documents of IFLA, the international Federation of Library Associations and Institutions.
MulDiCat.name: MulDiCat
